messages.author: groby
messages.text:
Wait, we've abandoned that part of the state machine?

Does that work, or are we now causing other issues? (I.e. "use another" from inline disposition, CWS results coming in _really_ late, etc.)

messages.author: Greg Billock
messages.text:
On 2012/10/15 17:24:12, groby wrote:
> Wait, we've abandoned that part of the state machine?
> 
> Does that work, or are we now causing other issues? (I.e. "use another" from
> inline disposition, CWS results coming in _really_ late, etc.)

No, that state is still there for the picker->inline case. Should I manually set the state to inline here?

Basically I want to not provoke the SetWaitingForSuggestions call.

messages.author: groby
messages.text: Does Cocoa/Gtk do the right thing?

messages.author: groby
messages.text:
Should the whole clause be part of show_use_another_service()?

(Also, the use of underscore for what looks like a logic instead of a getter function is a bit jarring)

messages.author: Greg Billock
messages.text:
On 2012/10/15 17:24:12, groby wrote:
> Does Cocoa/Gtk do the right thing?

Sailesh tested this on cocoa. GTK does not look at this flag at present. I need to look at that later.

messages.author: Greg Billock
messages.text:
On 2012/10/15 17:24:12, groby wrote:
> Should the whole clause be part of show_use_another_service()?

Arguably, but let's refactor that separately -- there's more cross-toolkit implication that way.

> 
> (Also, the use of underscore for what looks like a logic instead of a getter
> function is a bit jarring)
